event.title: ★Language-exchange Party for System Engineers ★Free Campaign for NonJapanese☆
event.description:
Thanks for your concern. We will hold a language exchange party in Tabata for system engineers. It’s a great chance to make new friends, ﬁnd language exchange partners, learn about other cultures, create personal connections of business and even ﬁnd romance in a casual party atmosphere! All people who are interested in international exchange are welcome!

If you speak English and study Japanese, you will be paired with a Japanese native speaker who want to practice English. Having daily conversation together, you will help him/her with English, and in return, you will be helped with your Japanese. This way you can learn useful language skills in a relaxed and interactive way. Language exchange is the best way to learn foreign language because it is easy, cheap and useful.

【Date】

October.11(Fri), 2019 19:30~21:30 (Last order 21:00)

【Time schedule】

19:30-20:30 Japanese Time

20:30-21:30 English Time

【Admission fee】

Non-Japanese： Free!
Japanese People： 2000 yen

※If a Japanese person brings a foreign friend, they can come free of charge.(both of them)

※Food & Drink : Cash Bar

※Minimum one drink per guest is required(over 500 yen).

【What to bring】

■Passport / Foreigner Registration / Residency Card/Business card etc

※We will check ID for legal drinking age.

※There is no luggage storage, Please keep the valuable to yourself.

【Directions】

Tabata Station north exit

↓

Overhead bridge on the right side

↓

Walk this bridge straight, there is a staircase to descend

↓

Down the stairs, go along a road, there is a crosswalk near police box

(you can see a grasse shop)

↓

Across straight, there is a sign of the meetup on the left side of the bar!

（about 4minutes）

【Notes】

■Participation for the purpose of solicitation or invitation is NOT allowed.

Soliciting MLM (network business), religion, sales, and event organizers of the same industry are strictly prohibited. Once these are discovered, we eject them immediately.

■ Do not harass the female attendants.

We want to provide a pleasant space and time to the participants, aggressive behavior toward female patrons is prohibited.
